intro: Hieracium hypochoeroides subsp. epimecodon, commonly known as the meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has basal and alternate leaves that are usually hairy and lance-shaped. This subspecies is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it is often found in disturbed soils.
